# MTLBlitPassSampleBufferAttachmentDescriptor

**Class**

A configuration that instructs the GPU where to store counter data from the beginning and end of a blit pass.

## Declaration

```swift
class MTLBlitPassSampleBufferAttachmentDescriptor
```

## Overview

See [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/sampling-gpu-data-into-counter-sample-buffers] for more context about configuring instances of this type. That article is one of a series of articles in [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/gpu-counters-and-counter-sample-buffers].

## Configuring the sample buffer attachment

- **sampleBuffer**: A specialized memory buffer that the GPU uses to store its counter data during the blit pass.
- **startOfEncoderSampleIndex**: An index within a counter sample buffer that tells the GPU where to store counter data from the start of a blit pass.
- **endOfEncoderSampleIndex**: An index within a counter sample buffer that tells the GPU where to store counter data from the end of a blit pass.

## Configuring a blit command encoder

- **MTLBlitPassDescriptor**: A configuration you create to customize a blit command encoder, which affects the runtime behavior of the blit pass you encode with it.
- **MTLBlitPassSampleBufferAttachmentDescriptorArray**: A container that stores an array of sample buffer attachments for a blit pass.
